ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and his wife and his children:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As well as his wife and children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and his consort and his children;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And from his wife and sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And from his wife and his children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And his spouse and his son--
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And his wife and his children,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And his wife and his sons;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And from his wife and his children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And from his wife and his children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And his consort and his children.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And his wife and his children,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [80:36] and his wife and his sons (yawma, ‘the day [when]’, is a substitution for idhā, ‘when’, the response to which is indicated by [what follows]) —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And his wife and his children) it is also said this means: when Abel will flee from Cain, and Muhammad (pbuh) will flee from his mother Aminah, and Abraham from his father, and Lot from his wife Wa'ilah and Nuh from his son Canaan.
